imaging.image_description: XR CHEST PA AND LATERAL 2 VIEWS, XR RIBS 3 OR MORE VIEWS WITH PA CHEST (RIGHT) INDICATION: Fall with right sided chest injury and pain. TECHNIQUE: PA and lateral views of the chest. Right rib series. A marker was placed on the skin overlying the site of maximal pain/tenderness at the right lower chest wall. COMPARISON: None. FINDINGS: The cardiopericardial silhouette is normal in size. No focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pulmonary vascular congestion. No pneumothorax.No definite radiographic evidence of an acute right rib fracture. IMPRESSION: No acute pulmonary process.No definite acute right rib fracture is identified radiographically.

dx.description: prophylactic immunotherapy for respiratory syncytial virus (RSV)

emr_dx.description: Encounter for prophylactic immunotherapy for respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) Enctr for prphylc immther for resp syncytial virus (RSV)

ai_summary.criteria: Child has a chronological age of > 24 months old
Child has a chronological age of < 12 months old
Child was born prematurely with a gestational age of 28 weeks & 6 days or less AND
Child’s current chronological age is less than or equal to 1 year at the beginning of RSV season (November 1st).
Child has a chronological age of 12 to 24 months old
The child was born with a Gestational Age (GA) of <32 weeks, 0 days AND
Required > 21 % oxygen AND,
for at least 28 days after birth AND,
Has confirmed diagnosis of chronic lung disease of prematurity (CLD) a.k.a. bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD), (ICD10: P27.1) AND
Information on how the CLD and/or BPD was diagnosed (i.e. x-ray)
AND continues to require medical treatment with either supplemental oxygen, chronic corticosteroids, or diuretic treatment within 6 months of the start of or during the current RSV season
supplemental oxygen OR
chronic corticosteroids OR
diuretic treatment OR

clinical_review_notes.notes: Does not meet the criteria for Synagis. The patient is less than 24 months old and older than 12 months old. There was no information on how the CLD and/or BPD was diagnosed.

pas.notifications: Does not meet the criteria for Synagis. The patient is less than 24 months old and older than 12 months old. There was no information on how the CLD and/or BPD was diagnosed.

ai_summary.criteria: Is this an initial request?
Does the patient have a diagnosis of Rheumatoid arthritis (RA)?
Was Orencia prescribed by or in consultation with a rheumatologist?
Has the patient had a 3-month trial of at least one biologic agent for RA?
Had a 3-month trial of at least one conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (sDMARD) (e.g., methotrexate, leflunomide, hydroxychloroquine)?
Does the patient have a diagnosis of Psoriatic arthritis (PsA)?
Was Orencia prescribed by or in consultation with a dermatologist or a rheumatologist?
Does the patient have a diagnosis of Juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA)?
Was Orencia prescribed by or in consultation with a rheumatologist?
Has the patient had a  trial of a biologic agent for JIA (e.g., adalimumab, etanercept)?
Has the patient had a  trial of a non-biologic agent for JIA (e.g., methotrexate, leflunomide)?
Will Orencia will be started concurrently with methotrexate, leflunomide, or sulfasalazine?
Does the patient have an absolute contraindication to methotrexate, leflunomide, or sulfasalazine (e.g., pregnancy, alcoholic liver disease, immunodeficiency syndrome, blood dyscrasias)?
Does the patient have aggressive disease?
Is this a re-authorization request?
Has the patient had a response to Orencia therapy (e.g., less joint pain, less morning stiffness, or less fatigue, improved function or activities of daily living)

emr_rx_hx.dosage: 1 capsule 3 x per day as needed
200mg every 2 weeks for 6 weeks then every 8 weeks after initial dosage
